parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To be ashamed, be ashamed of. From epi and aischunomai; to feel shame for something.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
From Hellas; a Hellen or inhabitant of Hellas; by extension a Greek-speaking person, especially a non-Jew.
